derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hlēapewince, from hlēapan 'to leap' and a base meaning 'move from side to side' (whence also wink); so named because of the way it flies. The spelling was changed in Middle English by association with lap and wing

entry.def: A lapwing is a small dark green bird which has a white breast and feathers sticking up on its head.

means.word_mean: 1. large crested Old World plover having wattles and spurs

auth_sentence.content: He hears a lapwing calling, but there aren't many birds up here.

auth_sentence.content: The Dyfi estuary is also one of the few strongholds for breeding lapwing and redshank in Wales.
